meanings.definition: Roughies (noun): A type of fish commonly found in Australian waters.
meanings.sent1: I saw a school of roughies swimming near the coral reef.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen caught some roughies for dinner.
meanings.sent3: Why did the roughies bring sandpaper to the ocean? To smooth out the waves!
meanings.sent4: The roughies in the sea danced like shimmering jewels in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the roughies made them stand out among the other fish.

meanings.definition: Roughies (adjective): Having a coarse or uneven texture.
meanings.sent1: The roughies sandpaper felt scratchy against my skin.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden table had a roughies surface from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The roughies blanket made me feel like I was sleeping on a bed of rocks.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a roughies quality that added depth to her singing.
meanings.sent5: The roughies fabric of the rug made it perfect for wiping muddy shoes.

meanings.definition: Roughies (verb): To handle or treat something in a rough or careless manner.
meanings.sent1: Please don't roughies handle the fragile vase.
meanings.sent2: He always roughies tosses his backpack on the floor when he comes home.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to roughies chop the vegetables for the stew.
meanings.sent4: She roughies dealt the cards quickly, causing them to scatter everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic roughies fixed the engine, causing more damage than before.
